author: GameSpot
description:
Mario Kart World builds on everything that made Mario Kart 8 Deluxe a fan favorite—offering new tracks, more characters, and chaotic multiplayer fun. Whether you're a longtime racer or just joining the series, this is the next evolution in high-speed, shell-slinging action on the Nintendo Switch. Get ready for the most expansive Mario Kart game yet!

SUBSCRIBE https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCbu2SsF-Or3Rsn3NxqODImw?sub_confirmation=1

0:00 – The Challenge of Following Mario Kart 8 Deluxe
0:42 – A Connected World: Tracks Become One Map
1:59 – Expansive Character Roster and Costumes
2:56 – Unlock Systems: Fun or Frustrating?
3:33 – Stickers & Customization Limits
4:25 – Switch 2 Graphics and Visual Upgrades
5:00 – Interconnected Courses and Visual Transitions
5:23 – Rainbow Road: Best Version Yet?
5:51 – New Mechanics: Charge Jump, Rail Grinding, and Water Handling
6:54 – Classic Modes and Revamped Battle Mode
7:26 – Knockout Tour: Mario Kart Meets Battle Royale
7:53 – Online Multiplay
title: Mario Kart World Review

author: GameSpot
description:
Max Blumenthal got 30 minutes of hands-on time with Invincible VS, and new studio Quarter Up, with key developers from the Killer Instinct team, incorporated some ideas that may catch the eye of some fighting game fanatics.

SUBSCRIBE https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCbu2SsF-Or3Rsn3NxqODImw?sub_confirmation=1

0:00 – Invincible Versus Hands-On Preview
0:15 – Classic Tag Fighter Mechanics Explained
0:42 – No Quarter Circles or Dragon Punch Inputs
1:04 – Killer Instinct Devs & Combo Breaker System
1:16 – Combo Mechanic and How to Extend Them
1:39 – Strategy Behind Assist Usage and Combo Breaks
2:16 – Sudden Death Mechanic Breakdown
2:40 – Directional Dashing and Triangle Jump Potential
3:01 – Boost Attacks and EX Move System
3:06 – Super Meter and Show-Inspired Supers
3:16 – Signature Gore: Blood, Guts, and Brutality
3:35 – Mortal Kombat Vibes and Final Thoughts
3:49 – Competing Tag Fighters and Genre Crowding
4:03 – Why Invincible Fans Should Be Excited

#invincible #invincibleVS #game
title: Invincible VS Has Cool Mechanics, But Is It Enough?

author: GameSpot
description:
The GameSpot crew had the chance to check out Capcom's latest action game, Pragmata. Pragmata mixes hacking puzzles with quick combat for a fresh take on the action genre.

0:00 – Pragmata Trailer at State of Play
0:09 – Hands-On Preview Begins
0:31 – Plot Overview: AI, Robots, and the Moon
0:48 – Meet Diana: Your Mysterious Companion
1:03 – Combat Isn’t What You Think
1:22 – Live Hacking Mini-Game Explained
1:48 – Exposing Weak Points for Big Damage
2:06 – Gears of War Comparison: Active Reload Vibes
2:20 – Strategic Combat with Positioning & Time-Slowing
2:33 – Weapon Variety: Pistol, Shotgun, and Net Trap
3:16 – Suit Abilities: Jumping, Hovering, and Space Logic
3:22 – Puzzle Exploration & Locked Doors
3:43 – Pragmata: A Promising Start

Stay ahead of the game with GameSpot's all-access coverage of Summer Game Fest 2025! From blockbuster reveals and world premieres to indie gems and developer interviews, we've got everything you need to know about this year's biggest gaming event.
title: Pragmata Isn't What You Think...

author: GameSpot
description:
We got a behind closed doors look at Onimusha: Way of the Sword, and it looks impressive. It takes aspects from the classic games while refining the combat and giving it the flair of modern action games.

SUBSCRIBE https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCbu2SsF-Or3Rsn3NxqODImw?sub_confirmation=1

0:00 – Sleep Awake: Spec Ops + Nine Inch Nails?

0:46 – Blumhouse’s Gaming Push
1:00 – What Kind of Game Is Sleep Awake?
1:31 – The “No Sleep” Premise Explained
2:00 – Coping Mechanisms in the Game World
2:23 – Meet Kata: The Protagonist
2:37 – Trippy Visuals & The Fathom Realm
3:16 – Music & Psychological Vibes
3:33 – Critique: Pacing and Gameplay Depth
3:58 – Humanity’s Collapse & Worldbuilding
4:10 – Stealth Section Breakdown
4:32 – Immersion and Audio Design
4:50 – Final Thoughts: Artistic Strengths vs Gameplay

Stay ahead of the game with GameSpot's all-access coverage of Summer Game Fest 2025! From blockbust
title: We Saw Onimusha: Way Of The Sword In Action And It Looks Impressive

author: GameSpot
description: We got hands-on with Resident Evil Requiem, and the terrifying experience left us with more questions than answers, along with confirmation of one key detail.
title: Playing Resident Evil Requiem Left Me With More Questions Than Answers
